Column Comment.0: RECORDS MANAGEMENT THESAURUS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a set ofwords or descriptors about a particular field or set of concepts, such as a list ofsubject headings or descriptors usually with a cross-reference system for use in theorganization of a collection of documents for reference and retrieval (from MerriamWebster Online)
Column Comment.1: THESAURUS WORD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a word or key word in athesaurus.
Column Comment.2: RECORDS MANAGEMENT THESAURUS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a set ofwords or descriptors about a particular field or set of concepts, such as a list ofsubject headings or descriptors usually with a cross-reference system for use in theorganization of a collection of documents for reference and retrieval (from MerriamWebster Online)
Column Comment.3: THESAURUS WORD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a word or key word in athesauru
Column Comment.4: CROSS REFERENCE OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique component added to allowthesaurus words to have complex relationships with each other. In many cases, therewill only be one observation number.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: RELATIONSHIP DESCRIPTION: A narrative description of the type of relationshipbetween the words, intended to supplement the information in XREF TYPE.
Column Comment.10: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE DOCUMENT: Unique identifier for the source document that is the originfor this thesaurus word, in the event that bibliographic references are desired.
Column Comment.13: THESAURUS CROSS REFERENCE TYPE: Use this value to indicate therelationship between words in two thesaurii, such as replaces previous value, exactsemantic meaning, sub type of semantic meaning, super type of semantic meaning,partial overlap in meaning, completely different meanings (use when the words arethe same, but the semantic does not correrspond).
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
